text: Yummy.  Always thinking to go there, and having the chance to go with my colleagues.  The food is delicious and price is good.   It does not take too long to wait in line, so it is convenient to go there during lunch time.   I love chicken kabob.  We will go back again.

Great food. I had the chicken kabob with rice. Great flavor and cooked perfect. I also had the hummus and must say that it has got to be the best I've ever had. Yum! Great location too, next to the airport. Watched airplanes take off and land.

I had the 2 Kubideh special for $11.99.  I chose the ground beef & ground chicken Kubideh Kabobs.  There was plenty of food on the plate to fill me up.  Both versions of the kabobs were cooked perfectly.  They both were cooked to order and came out nice & hot.  The rice was well rice so it was on the dry side as usual no matter where you get it.  I should have asked to see if I could get some type of sauce for it.  I did add some roasted and chopped hot peppers to it which had a great taste.  I also added some other green sauce / salsa type of thing which also was flavorful.  Sorry don't know the name of it.  I really enjoyed the fresh bread that came with the order.  They served both the kabobs on the bread so the juices soaked in a little to give it more flavor.  The plate also would have come with a roasted tomato & mixed greens but I did not get them.  I did get the onions and asked for extra which they gladly gave me a bunch of.

The only negative about my experience there was that I would have had to pay for a side of the garlic sauce.  That is not a big negative but wish the dish would come with a little side already.  

The young lady that took my order was real nice and answered all the questions I had as this was my 1st visit.

They have a good size dining area which was very clean as was the bathroom.

Overall I enjoyed the food very much.  It was a great price especially for the amount of food I received.  I will be going back for sure.  If it was a little bit closer to the house I would probably go there a couple times a week.
The restaurant is very bad, service and eating form without flavor and its price-Ghali, was a bad experience

I went there with the wife and kids. We had the Kubidah kabob which was perfect in flavor and tenderness, a Beef Gyro, also perfect, the tenderlion lamb was a bit undercooked/chewy and the shredded chicken, also felt undercooked. Overall, its a good place in LV area, though not the best for kabob. most dishes come with rice, half mideastern style pita bread, green salad a grilled tomatoe and chopped onions. As for portions, I guess big customers like myself, its almost enough, average diners will find it hard to finish and kids will have to ask for a to-go box.
Prices are average for value and the staff are decent but can definitely use a smile on their faces.
This place will not be among my top list to come back to when I'm in town next time, unless I'm living within a walking distance and don't have a car!
Love the friendliness, Great food

I have eaten here a few times and the food has been good. On the website says delivery so I called and the woman that answered the phone said she did not know if they delivered. She told me to call back in 5 minutes. Ok I called back in 5 minutes and she still did not know. Poor customer service, did not offer to call me back or anything. I guess i will be eating something else for lunch.

Every time I go here,I order the beef kabobs which are always amazing. The rice and bread that come with it are equally delicious too. The only downfall to this place is that the food takes FOREVER to come out and it is pretty steep in price for a quick lunch.

Several weeks ago we stumbled in to Fresh Kabob on Sunset Road as a total fluke. The food was absolutely delicious and gave us the idea to order it for an upcoming Halloween party. What a great decision that turned out to be!

The food was promptly delivered at exactly the time we requested...I mean right at the exact time we asked for it to be delivered!!! That took a huge stress off of us and allowed our housekeeper to transfer the food into proper buffet server/warmers before our guest arrived. Fresh Kabob brought over dinner for 25 people including salads, incredible rice and extremely tasty Kabobs. Our guests absolutely LOVED the food. We encouraged them to go and support Fresh Kabob by dining there regularly as this is the kind of business that should be supported and rewarded. 

To give you an idea of the amount of food. We had a total of 19 people. We ordered the dinner for 25 and added some sides of hummus and tabuli salad. We also supplemented the dinner with some chicken wings. That made it perfect for a group of people with pretty big appetites and and even gave us a few leftovers for us to enjoy the following day.

I love this place. If you ever host a party and want something different than the ordinary, give Fresh Kabob a chance. You and your guests will be happy you did.

Thank you again Fresh Kabob. You helped make our party a great success!
Outstanding lamb, just outstanding.  Bread was fresh and hot and delicious!!!
This is the best place in Vegas to eat Kabobs.  The fresh taftoon bread in town with the best prices...  And the view is awesome...
Very good Mediterranean food... Big serving is another plus... overall best in Las Vegas... and a view of the Las Vegas Airport.... specially seeing planes landing... great food great view...

Used the on-line ordering system, filled in all of the required fields, and submitted the order.  Showed up at the designated pick-up time and was told the on-line ordering system doesn't work.

There was no indication on the web-site that it didn't work!  Luckily they weren't real busy, but had to cool my heels for over 20 minutes.

The food was good, not great.  Portions were well sized.  Prices were reasonable.

Bottom line, my time is valuable and I will explore other options before returning to eat here, but won't rule them out completely.

Good place to go and eat. But the meat was a bit dry, but that might be because we waited a while before ate the food. The taste was really good. I think it would have been better if we sat in the restaurant and ate. 

I definitely would go back to get some more food here.

If I could give no stars I would, ordered for delivery my food came in an hour, but still warm when it got here. I got 2 beef kebabs, hummus and baklava, the rice was so dry and tasted burnt, the beef had no flavor, the hummus basically had a bottle of oil on top, I had to pour out the oil just to get to the hummus. The baklava was the best thing out of the whole order and that wasn't even very good it was dry and crunchy.
I ordered chiken kabab but I got something look like lactic and it taste was terrible. I was the worst food that I have ever eaten.
Great food. I had the lamb and chicken ground Kabob. Came with rice and side salad. It's off strip so parking is easy. :-)
Delicious food, very fresh. The green sauce is very good.

First off the place is super clean!  I was surprised.

As far as the food, 

- delicious
- healthy
- prepared quickly
- great customer service
- and super filling (we had left overs for my family of 4.  Go figure!

Great job guys!

I have my entire office addicted to this place! The food is always fresh, flavorful and plentiful. I also like that they take call in orders which really works well when getting lunch for a group of people. My go-to is the chicken kabob which comes with saffron rice, salad, onions and bread. Their yogurt cucumber sauce is excellent, too, and comes in a generous portion with more bread.

I had heard good things about Fresh Kabob so I bought the yelp $20 for $40 deal.  I highly recommend buying the  yelp deal.  For two of us, we had enough for another full meal.  The hummus was a little different from what I was used to (Trader Joe's Hummus) but it was flavorful and had a nice texture.  The flat bread was excellent.  The lamb kabobs were  tender and the chicken kabobs were  excellent.  I will be back.  Oh the saffron rice was the best I've had.  Tip; buy the Yelp  deal!!

I have dinner here once a week with my roomie because we absolutely love it!! Environment is relaxing! We can just go there and talk for hours!!! The food is amazing & the staff is great!!!  When the main cook is on duty everything tastes so much better!!! Btw, He is a hottie!!! Totally recommend this Medit. Rest! 100% on Point!!!
WARNING*** This business is closed. Me and my wife were going to eat dinner when we realized the place has been seized by the city.

This is near the office. It's the best kabob place around for the price. Even my vegetarian co-worker loves it. They have a gyros and fries meal for $5.99. It's just the right size for lunch. The side of hummus is somewhere around three bucks. It's really good and a good portion.

Ordered no. 11, 12, 18 and the Mast.O.Khiar "yogurt & cucumber".  No. 11 is the combo chicken: cube skewer and a ground skewer. No. 12 is the lamb combo: cubes and ground each on a skewer. No. 18 the fried chicken tenders with fries. All orders served with saffron rice, fresh baked bread and lettuce. We also Sampled the hummus. 

We all agreed that both lambs; cubes and ground, were really good. Flavor enhanced with dry rosemary topped on the meat and grilled with it. 
We all also agreed the kebob chicken was below average. Although the chicken was topped with rosemary identical to the lamb, we felt the rosemary was a distraction to the tast an not an enhancent. Also the Chicken kebobs had the raw chicken taste/smell. 

All kebobs, lamb and chicken were juicy and and tender, and perfectly salted; a must for any kebob place to master regardless of taste to be even considered a kebob joint. Otherwise it is just somebody with a grill and meat on skewer, which is not kebob. 

However, the fried chicken was really good. I even joked that he is in the wrong business; being a kebob place instead of fried chicken. The only downer he served the yougurt-cucumber as a dip, and I wished for more options like coleslaw for instance. The fries were okay, McDonald's quality, I personally didn't enjoy them. 

We didn't like the saffron rice. It lacked flavor and it was hard to chew, to be fair we only eat aged basmati rice, nothing else, so it could just be a matter of food habit. 

The yougurt cucumber sauce/ dip needs to be more liquified. It felt little bit dry, but was acceptable. The bread was hot and fresh, just normal. 

The hummus sucks big time. I also asked to sample the baba ganouj but was told it was already prepacked. So I passed on it hence the hummus sucked. 

Service was good, food was fast and timely. 

Portions were nice and generous. Pricing was very reasonable. I used the yelp deal $40 for $20, which saved us $20. Even without the yelp deal, pricing is still good. 

The place is clean and neat. Has couple of booths and the rest are tables. The decor was simple with a small touch of elegant. 

Bathroom spacious, modern and extremely clean, a major plus.  

We disliked the TV volume which was very high. The signal was lost for a while and the place went really quite, then back to the loud noise. 

Self service. You order, pay at ordering, then pick up when your number is called. 

We would've given it a 5 star, despite our dislikings, but hence all sides were at the same price, however they refused to substitute the rice for any other side. We found this a downer. Why you want to force me to eat a side that I don't like?

 FYI. I disapprove of rice being the side dish with kebobs regardless of the rice edibility. I think kebobs a thirst-triggering meat course should go with more moist side like hummus, baba ganouj,... etc. 


In conclusion it is worth a visit. 

Just a quick note, I spoke in plural because that was the opinion of the group and not only me. However the detailed description is my own product. 

Hopefully, you'd find my review helpful and informative.
My boyfriend and I have been customers for at least two years. I always get the #4. Definitely recommend this place if they are looking for good food.
Fresh Kabob is not so fresh. The meat was dry and over cooked. Nice view of the airport, but would not eat here again.

In town visiting family and had a craving for a gyro. Found this place on Yelp and hoped for the best. The gyro was good, could have used more yogurt sauce and no need for fries - they were previously frozen. My aunt had the lamb kabob. It was a little dry but well seasoned. I love pistachio ice cream so I gave it a go. I wouldn't advise it. Ice had collected on the top and it left a weird coating on my tongue. My aunt's baklava was good, I would go with that.
Lamb kabobs and saffron rice is pretty good. Love the green sauce! Not close to home or work so I come here whenever I'm in the area.

For a great Mediterranean meal going to or from the airport make Fresh Kabob your stop. Exceptional value and fun to watch the planes! We had #4 beef kabob and #13 beef and lamb and the baba ganoush. All excellent and the green hot sauce was delicious. Highly recommend.

Great halal food. 

Near Vegas airport and 15 minutes away form the strip.

Portions were generous and enough for two meals.

First time at Fresh Kabob and it's really the place to eat from culture. It's really a clean place. The view is great. You have a view of the landing at McCarran Airport. Please try the bread. It's so delicious and only .99¢. It's a great place. The owners are professional, clean cut people. Eat! Eat! Eat! Here!

As soon as I walked into this place, I had a bad feeling.  I ordered my lunch online for pickup and stood at the counter for about 3-4 mins before anyone even acknowledged my existence, and only bc I had to speak up and tell one of the cooks I was there for a pickup order.  He said, "Pick up order?" and raised his eyebrows like he didn't know what I was talking about.  It was ready, so I will give them that, but I don't care how good the food is in a restaurant - if the customer service sucks, I won't go back.  Nobody greeted me when I walked in, nobody said goodbye when I left, nobody said thank you when I picked up my food.

I wanted something better than normal fast food for lunch and remembered that a bookmarked this Kabob place. As advertised they are fresh and authentic Mediterranean. Made to order, i had the beef combo. It was good, a little pricey but give them a little slack for freshness, but wish it included some hummus.

Holy yum!   Found this place via Uber eats and loved it so much I tracked it down to make sure my access to it isn't limited to an Uber delivery. :-).  Delicious food and incredible hummus and spicy sauces.

Food was really good! Good portions and prices. Staff was very polite and friendly. Gyro was great, my husband had the chicken shawarma and that was really good too, the only let down for me was the rice and baba ghanoush.......wasn't bad, just underwhelming. Hummus was fantastic. Dining area was very clean and the ladies bathroom was also very clean. Will be back!!!!
I use to live in Dubai.This place is only place that come closed to my taste for the simple freshest made to order food.Its self service.But the food is four star.

After ordering a meal, they gave me a dressing for the side and it was molded! After showing the mold to the guy that was working at the front register, he tried to convince me that it was normal! Then he told me that he was wrong and threw it in the trash. Then he gave me another dressing from the same place he got the first one. I told the manager that everything in that fridge was contaminated. He replied "it was just that one everything else is still good!" I plan on reporting this to the health district.

Been coming here for my falafel wrap. It's a nice and cheap lunch. Comes with alot of greens,tomato,onions and wedge of lemon. Haven't had anything to complain about. The area has nice big windows overlooking the strip buildings.
I got this via Postmates and unfortunately found the chicken to be very dry and the steak very tough.
Place is terrible. Lied about the yelp deal & the place stinks like doggy dookie

With the Yelp deal, I tried several items. I was excited about the options, but the food was pretty ordinary. The cucumber and yogurt side was the best part of the order. Also, a plate comes with 6 pieces of meat... get ready to load up on bread and rice (though both were good). I won't be back, but I'd say it's worth a try on the off-chance you don't have my exact taste buds. My search for middle eastern food continues.

Chicken and lamb skewers have lots of flavor, little on the salty side. The gyro meat was too dry and crispy. The girl at the register looks like she hates her job, didn't smile once, pretty much rolled her eyes when I asked for a cup for water. 

Oh! The baba ghanoush was tasty and a good size portion for only 1.99!

Everything was amazing! My food was hot, fresh, and flavorful. I ordered the chicken kebob, with a side of tabouli, and a side of garlic sauce. I live in the Northwest and drove all the way to this location because the food is so tasty. I definitely recommend this place, and will be back!

Tried this place today and it was pretty good for being in and industrial work area. The shish kabobs were tender, the pilaf - perfect. Portions are decent sized. We noticed that the restaurant attracts a lot of middle easterners because it's 'halal'. They are constantly making fresh hot flat bread which is the best. Only missing a star because the homemade dips are refrigerated too cold and that doesn't work well with the rest of the food. But well worth the trip.

the people here are jerks.  their food is decently good though.  but they have a huge sign that says "2 koobideh's for $9.99.  Lamb. Beef or Chicken." and I tried to order this with the "Yelp Deal" and they said "oh, that is a special, you can't get that with the 'coupon.'  They said I could buy the same thing for $14.  I said it wasn't much a special "yelp deal" if I can't order off their regular menu.  I asked them where it said "special" but it didn't.  They just were trying to rape customers' bank accounts.  If you are going to have a special - then make it a real special.    then they said I could not get the ice cream without paying extra since i was "using a coupon" - but it was the Yelp Deal.  Please put these jerks out of business.  Sadly though, their food is good (albeit not great).  I would rather go to the real Flame Kabob that they screwed over, that is on Eastern and they are nicer to their customers.
Dud an Uber Eats pick up and grabbed a piece of the taftoon bread. Absolutely delicious and super cheap at $1.66. Staff was really friendly!

I ordered Lunch Combo (Tenderloin Chicken with french fries) for $8.99

food looks and tasted good. 

Location with special view to the Runway from the McCarran International Airport.

My third time to this place over the years it's been open. Not overly impressed. A few tasty things on the menu but definitely overpriced for what you get. 

Rice, VERY dry with absolutely no flavor. For a Mediterranean place, you need something more than just plain white rice. 

Hummus. Also very plain tasting. For hummus being an al-la-carte item, one piece of pita bread is not cool. I mean come on, it's bread. Don't make me discover it's only enough for one person when u give me a family size portion of hummus. I forgot about this when it happened last time. Shame on me. 

The chicken and lamb were both good kabobs. My girlfriend wanted a lamb/veggie kabob combo and they charged her full price for 2 entrees. 

The spicy sauce u can serve urself is very good. Do not forget to get this!

Overall, there are better Kabob spots nearby. $32 for me and my girl to get kabobs with no drinks/dessert is crazy. I say this place is only good in a pinch.

I am still eating while writing this.  The meat was a little bland.  It's more like the seasoning was only on the outside but bland on the inside.  Needs more marinating time.  Maybe we got a bad batch but the basmati rice was soooo soggy that our table and the one table beside us went to the service counter to ask for a replacement.  The replacement was the same sorry soggy rice considering that basmati is a firm type of rice.  Maybe it's just the restaurant quality going downhill.  Tsk tsk!

For a fast food Mediterranean food I give this place 4 star. Their portions are big and pretty tasty for a fast food restaurant. I got chicken shish kabob, hummus and tea and it's $1500. I didn't realize it's a lot for me that's why I wasn't able to finish it. I recommend this for a kabob fast food place.

I have chose this place a few times for lunch since its close to my job. The only reason it gets 4 out of 5 is the staff is a bit dry, i have never recieved a greeting from them or a have a good day. Now for the food my regular dish is 2 kabob combo one beef one chicken and i occasionally mix it up with a lamb kabab. This dish never lets me down big portions full of flavor and the dish always looks appetizing with the bright colors in the rice and the flat bread that come with the food is amazing they put the kababs on top the bread and it adds so mych flavor to the bread. My husband took a risk today and tried the gyro i have to say hands down the best we have had since we have been in vegas! It had nice chunks of lamb there was just the right amount of tzatziki sauce.

Excellent inexpensive kabobs. First place I stop whenever I fly into town. Convenient from the airport and worth going out of your way for. 
The ground meat  kabobs are all excellent.
Everything is fresh and made to order. 
I'm moving to Vegas soon and I know this place will be on my weekly rotation of places to eat.

The food was a lot and it is worth the price.  I had a BOGO gyro that made it more of an incentive to go there.  Everything was delicious, especially the home made pita bread!!!!!  I would get one of those breads anyday.  They cater too!

BABA GHANOUSH. AND DAT BREAD.

This will honestly be just a review about the baba ghanoush. It's delicious. Spiced just right. So inexpensive. As good as the baba that I've had in $$ and $$$ restaurants. Comes topped with sliced black olives (which I wish were whole and preferably a different variety, but you overlook the small things in the presence of perfection). 

If you like hummus and you haven't tried baba ghanoush, you're a fool. Try some. Preferably from here.

And the bread. Homemade. Soft. Warm. This is no Wonder® Taftoon. It's the real deal, made in house in a tandoori. And you can order an extra 12" round of it for 99 CENTS. I may just go here every day and buy some rather than keep bread in the house. 

The real reason I came here was because it was close to my house and they had falafel. Which was also excellent. A little dry, but falafel is a fickle thing sometimes. Comes with a good sauce and all the right fixings, all of which were very fresh. Guess what it was served on? More delicious flat and warm goodness. The only way to improve this would probably be by adding some baba.

Definitely getting that Yelp deal next time and taking my roommates.

Baba Ghanoush 2016
Food was fresh and really good. I loved the environment except it wasn't as clean as I would of hoped and the employees didn't greet us and wasn't Very welcoming
Everything was good, they mixed up with orders a little but because of us! Price wasn't expected, little high! But food was great!

Great food, great portions, great service, great decor. Would definitely eat here again. Chicken kabobs weren't dry (thank God) like so many other kabob places and were seasoned just right. Same for the beef kabobs. Rice could use a little salt/lemon, but still very good. Cheesecake is also awesome. Everything very reasonably priced. In town for another work conference, and this place is conveniently located close to most convention halls.

Impressed. Nice almost fast food place.(food made to order). Had the #7 chicken Karahi which came with freshly made pita bread and some greens and the spicy chicken. Very good meal. Fountain drinks are with refills.

Yummy !! They have pictures to choose so no need to ask when you don't know how to order
Great food very quick, and reasonable price!

Wife and I were looking for a different place to eat in the area when we YELPed this place.  We saw the 4 star rating and decided we wanted to try it.  It lived up to its expectations.  Food was good and service was great.  We have been back 3 different times now.  Good break from fast food.

First things first: if you haven't gone yet, purchase the Yelp deal. $20 for $40 is half price, and even if you take it to go, you WILL eat it. Once you've made your purchase, get in your car and get your butt there.

From the outside, this place doesn't really look like much. It's clean, and newish, but that's about all I could tell. Inside it's clean too, with tables as well as some couches and comfy chairs to pick for seating. It's a walk-up-and-order type of place, too, so step back to read the menu and make your selection so you don't hold up the line. There was a good group there when I went, but not enough to call it crowded- there's a large screen where some folks were watching the Spain/Italy soccer match, which seems to change based on what is playing at the time. If you're not the sports type, they also have free wifi- ask the cashier for the password. 

The menu is pretty diverse, with kabobs (hence the name) taking the majority, but some wrap sandwiches and other grilled meats, too. I love Persian and Mediterranean cuisine, and this place had a good mix of offerings from lamb, chicken, and tenderloin kabobs to chicken schwarma wrap and sides such as hummus and dolmas. 
I had the chicken schwarma wrap, BF had the lamb kabobs, and we got extra bread and hummus for the table. Other dining partners ordered slightly different variations of the same, but beef dishes. Everyone dug in and loved the food- it was hot, fresh, and flavorful, and in ample portions. The plates each had sides of a small salad or dolmas, and rice or hummus- these are probably interchangeable, but i have to say that the rice was surprisingly good! Very moist and flavorful, it perfectly complemented the lamb dishes.

I can definitely see us coming back here- and probably frequently, too. They have a menu board up front offering specials, including pistachio ice cream, that we plan on trying next visit.
Loved the gyro, friendly staff, great location and affordable prices.  Will definitely return.

My first time. Always pass by this place and finally trying it out. One word, delicious!!! I had the chicken and lamb kubideh. Came with saffron rice, salad, grilled tomato, and fresh bread for $12. This is a lot of food for this price. I'll be coming back for more!

Went here a few nights ago with some friends, and we actually really loved the food! So tasty and so cheap with large portions. Only knocked one star off because it was quite salty so maybe not the healthiest food possible, but it tastes amazing! Can't wait to go back here again.

I really wanted to like this place, and it ok, I really like that the ordering is easy and the restaurant is clean and orderly. The food was just ok, lots of oil but suprisingly flavorless. The service was incredibly slow..... 
If you are looking for super tasty Mediterranean food, try just around the corner at Kabob Express on Tropicana near Eastern Ave. Not as clean, but infinitely more tasty.

I was pleasantly surprised.... The food and the service was good. And for my atrocious spelling below I apologize in advance...I guessed as best as I could for the food spelling...lol. :)

I ordered the dolma...I think next time this will be a pass... It was cold and really had no flavor but with their sauce it was decent but I would not order it again. Just not worth it. I've had better at other places.

The bread on the other hand was fantastic!! I ordered extra bread not realizing that my order would come with half... Bit am I glad that I had it. The bread was soft... Chewy.. And just perfect! I would definitely get this one again.

Baba Ganoush... Was decent... The flavor was OK... Would I order it again... Probably... Why? Cuz I really really really like baba ganoush. :)

Now for the actual dish. I got the lamb kubideh... And it was delish! My bf thought that it had too much seasoning but for me it was perfectly seasoned! The lamb was so good with the bread. The rice I would pass on. It had no flavor... But the bread and the lamb was perfect! 

My bf had the beef kabob and I thought that it was under seasoned but he loved it. But then again he thought that my lamb was over seasoned. Lol 

Either way, even though it is a drive for me to get there...I will definitely be back.

Tried the lamb kubideh. It was very reasonable pricing, for $7.99 I got a healthy serving of kubideh with rice, and bread. They make the bread at the location! Everything tasted wonderful. And we ended our meal with a Baklava. Do try it!

I would give them 0 stars if I could. I wanted Persian food (kabob and saffron rice). Their food is more Indian than Persian. They did not even use saffron, it was food coloring. I was very disappointed and will never go back.
We tried the chicken shish kabob and it was very delicious. The place is not fancy but clean and warm. Will come back here when we visit Vegas next time.
Arrived right on time, fresh, hot food, great flavor and really good deal for the price. Met the owner as well and he was very nice.

I feel like I've tried virtually every Mediterranean place in the valley. Was looking for a good spot near   where I was located a few days ago and stumbled upon Fresh Kabob. 

The first few things that stood out to me were that the inside was new and modern (very clean, LED screens for the menu boards), and the aroma was great! From when I walked in the door it smelled like the fresh food was on the plate in front of me. 

The prices were very reasonable. I went with the $11.99 special of ground chicken and lamb kabobs and my co-worker went with the grilled chicken breast @ $8.99. 

The portion sizes are second to none as it relates to their competitor restaurants in Las Vegas. I got very full and I have a hearty appetite. 

The food was delicious. I have not tried better Mediterranean in the valley and I will certainly be back soon. I highly recommend you give this place a shot!

I've tried several Kabob places around the Eastside and have to say that Fresh Kabob is the best in terms of price, taste, and convenience.   Fresh Kabob is one of my go-to lunch spots.  

I usually get #4 Beef Shish kabob for a great price $9.   The quality of the beef shish kabob is a little inconsistent though; most of the time it is tender and so very good, but sometimes it is a little tough.  The #1 Koubideh $7 is also good if you like ground, seasoned beef.  Sometimes the koubideh is a little too dry though.   That's why Fresh Kabob ends up with a 4 star, instead of 5.

You get a lot of sides with your entry: grilled tomato, small salad, rice, and pita bread.   The rice is the best out of all the kabob places I've tried... fluffy and moist, not dry and hard like elsewhere.   Don't forget to get some of the best mint chutney on the Eastside (spicy and sour green sauce), at the counter; I use that mint chutney with everything (meat, rice, and salad).

Fresh Kabob is located in the corner of a mini strip mall just south of the airport so there is plenty of parking in the lot.   You order and then wait for them to call your number.   There are comfortable sofas for waiting and a soda machine that also dispenses soda water (besides plain water).

If you prefer chicken kabob, I recommend Kabob Express which has the most tender chunks of marinated chicken.

I had the gyro and it was pretty good, the rice could have had a little more flavor but it was still good. Their jalapeños and green sauce mix great with their dishes. The name fresh describe them well which is important when it comes to food.

Food was OK but I've had a lot better.  For some reason they served naan bread rather than lavash.  Worst of all the service was rude and unprofessional.  I'm sure there are better options in las vegas.  Will go elsewhere next time.

Really good Kabobs, we had the beef and chicken when we came and as everyone has said the green sauce is absolutely delicious and flavorful. I had a peach carbonated soda that was really good to and not too sweet. I will be back and you should go too.

Came here because we were craving some Persian food. 
It had good ratings on yelp so we decided to try it. We ordered the Beef Kubideh and the Chicken Tenderloins. The beef Kubideh was really good. Very well seasoned and the grilled tomato was the best! The chicken tenderloin was good very juicy and very well seasoned. 

I also ordered the hummus with pita bread. The pita bread was warm when I got my order. 

Overall the place was pretty good and wasn't too expensive. 

Must try!

AGAIN, I had lunch here. This time I took a friend. As always, I loved everything from the super nice lady who always recognizes my voice when I call in an order to (of course) the food. As expected, so did he. The quality has never changed in nearly a year of visiting and I'm not in the market for a new kabab place. 

My only recommendation for the business would be to have a separate area for orders that have been called in to pay and pick up their food. Having to wait in line behind people who are ordering (for my food that is already made) is a bit inconvenient.

Came here the other day and got the Ground Chicken Kubideh and it was great.  I actually took it To-Go and headed across the street to the parking lot where you can park and watch the airplanes land at McCarran.  There I enjoyed this very tasty meal, and will soon do it again.

They use styrofoam for everything (not just their to-go boxes). The activist in me can't see past the piles and piles of styrofoam they unapologetically go through each day. I will admit that the food is good, but not good enough for me to go back.

Prett much everything I've tried here I liked.  The meat (whichever kind) is always cooked well, pita is always fresh and their seasoned fries are pretty good too.  Garlic dip is great although it's extra.

They have "American" choices as well like burgers.  I tried the Philly Cheesesteak on a whim one time and it was surprisingly good.  

One of the few places close to my work I can get decent food and be back in 30 min.  Ordering ahead online (Yelp) or by phone will save you a quite bit of time.
Nice stop for me and the kids after soccer practice at sunset park. Yelp deal made us stop and the kids loved the beef kabobs and rice.

i love this place. i used to order here multiple times a month before moving. They have the best chicken karahi and gyros. I recommend trying whatever sweet they have in the refrigerator because its always worth it.

Good presentation,fare portion!
The falafel is dry and too much spice,not Mediterranean.As well as the kabab.

OK-- I have to admit, I was not expecting to love this place as much as I did. Behind the counter were 5-6 guys who didn't look excited to be there.

I opted for the chicken shish kabob -since that seemed like the safest choice for my first visit. To my surprise, the chicken was well seasoned and cooked perfectly. My wife opted for the beef tenderloin shish kabob, which I thought was even better than the chicken.Then the meal got better....

Along side the chicken was a delicious tri-colored rice that was so smooth. Oh, and I can't forget about that warm homemade bread that was served with it--- WOW! 

And then, I discovered something inside the restaurant that blew my mind! They offer an amazing chutney (limit one small cup per customer) that goes with chicken, beef, and anything else you could think of. Spiced perfectly, this wonderful sauce is the perfect compliment to the robust flavors this restaurant offers.

This place gets a 5 star rating from me. Next time, I will be getting some bread and chutney to go!  

Go now! -Thank me later...

Had the lamb kabob with a side of hummus. It was delicious. 
I'll come again for sure.

Ordered on Eat24.  Got an order confirmation.  After over an hour, I called the restaurant, which said "we had no driver, so we can't confirm."  So now we're an hour late on eating, no remorse from the restaurant, and furious.  Do NOT order from this place if you want delivery.  UGH.
Nasty and awful. The whole family had the chicken kebab, with was very hard coded with lemon, way to much. The tomato was under cooked. Even the rice was coded with lemon.
Great food, very fresh. Nice change from fast food. The chicken kabob is awesome. Can not wait to try more menu items.
Best thai place. Whatever you order, it will be good. Couldn't try some dishes because of its price but everything i've tried were the bests. Cozy, historic, good services.

Hands down, the BEST kabobs in Vegas. 

I stopped here late after work one night on the way home after having passed it at least a thousand times, and decided to give it a try. I went in, placed my order, and after about 15 minutes, was on my way home. 

The inside is cozy, there is a new hookah lounge upstairs (not technically the same business), for those who might be interested in that. The tables inside were pretty low key, but the kitchen area is open except for some glass, so you get to watch your food prepared while you wait which is always a nice touch. Some people don't like that, but I do, it forces restaurants to practice more hygienic practices because customers can see more. 

The young lady who rang me up was helpful and friendly. The gentleman who gave me my food, apologized for the wait (15 minutes is not long in my book, but maybe for some it is), and said that calling ahead is a great option if you're ever in a hurry in the future. 

I ordered a lamb and chicken shish kabob. They were both DELICIOUS. Many kabobs in this city are incredibly bland and under seasoned, definitely not the case here. The rice was also well flavored. The green sauce that was at the counter where you pick up your food was perfectly spiced and I put it on EVERYTHING! I appreciate the fresh lemon wedge that was included in my to-go container. 

My only real complaint was the price. It was more than $17 for two kabobs, which I thought was on the expensive side. If they took their prices down around $2, I'd be here way more often that is good for my wallet...

I love the quality of food here it's always fresh and portions are generous! I get their #5 Chicken shish plate and it's very good! Prices are decent for the food you get, but can get expensive if you end up getting the Salmon Plate. Overall a good lunch option for on the go or dining in.

I'm going to be honest here with this review. I usually love kabob places and I saw that this place had 4 stars and I was impressed by the amount of reviews and rating so I decided to give this place a try. So I came here yesterday with my man and we were a little disappointed in this place see he's Persian and he always takes me to good Iranian places and this place has like a twist between Iranian and Mediterranean flavors. We got the chicken kabob plate with the rice and salad and we also got the shirazi salad for the appetizer. So I'll start with the appetizer. Shirazi isn't supposed to be spicy they add jalapeños and not enough salt. Don't get me wrong I love spicy stuff but when it comes to this it's not supposed to have that ingredient in it. And the chicken it was alright a little on the salty side but it wasn't horrible. And for the rice I'm going to be brutally honest here it seemed like low quality basmati rice it just didn't taste too well. I hate having to rate this place a two but I was more disappointed than impressed like I hoped I would be. Maybe I'll give them a second chance someday idk.

I had the ground lamb kabob plate and it was awesome. They have this amazing saffron rice served along side and the green sauce at the pick up counter is really flavorful. I would definitely eat her again when I'm on this side of town. Yum!!!  I have a happy tummy :)
My eyes are bigger than my stomach. Always a reliable choice for healthy chicken and beef. I like the # 7 Chicken, lettuce, dolmi, and humus.

Took my husband here for his first time. I hyped up this place to him, only to be disappointed. My husband ordered beef and I ordered chicken. The meats were full of flavor and tender. The only downside was the rice. It had a very weird/ almost smelt like a chemical. The rice did not taste right. It was very bitter. Unsure what happened. Anywho I reported to the manager and she offered us a free slice of cake. Just wish the rice was good! :/
I had a problem with $5 for $10 deal which the workers not aware but the owner was able to fix the issue.

I have been here twice already and I really love this place. I wish it was closer to home so that I could go here more often. I haven't been able to find a better one in town. I am drooling right now thinking of it.

I have only tried their kubideh, both chicken and beef. The wrap is similar, but I would rather just get their kubideh special. It is so flavorful! The rice tastes soooo good and the veggies so fresh! I love their food! And a bonus, their drinks are refillable!

It can get pretty busy here during lunchtime on the weekday, so if you only have 30 minutes to spare, I suggest ordering over the phone and picking up so you don't have to waste your lunch waiting.

Don't forget to order baklava for dessert! It is divine.

Fresh Kabob has been a solid option for my family any time we are in the mood for gyros or kabobs.   After multiple visits to ensure their delicious meals were not one-hit wonders, I can safely place my stamp of approval.   

We tend to order their kabob special, two meats + rice + salad.   Whether you choose chicken, beef, or lamb, you're guaranteed one of the best options in Vegas.   The accompanying sauces for the meat compliment the food really well.  The value is seen in the portion sizes.   Two long kabob strips plus a generous scoop of their colorful rice make me a happy camper.

I have also ordered gyro meat here for $4 and they give a generous portion of it for the money along with tzatziki white sauce.   It's fairly good and worth it if you are hungry.

Their space has always been kept clean and the staff were nice and friendly.   They also have a nice digital check-in option where you earn points for free drinks, food, and dessert.

Best place for fast, good Persian food!  

I always order the #4 Tenderloin Beef Shish Kabob with an order of fries and side of Mast o Khiar (tzatziki sauce). The entree comes with bread, saffron rice, onions and salad. Tie everything together with their green house sauce, which is the boss, and you got a delicious, savory, authentic meal. 

I also ordered the hummus. It was just ok here. 

Tip: Yelp $20 for $40 Deal!

Delicious.  This was my 2nd time here and it was consistently good.   My daughter's first time and she too, loved it.   

The points program was a little confusing and the cashier seemed uncertain.  The advertisement on the front door didn't match the program?

I had the chicken k-bob and my daughter had the chicken sandwich, and they were nice to change the bun to a wrap.    Both lunches were large portions and delicious.

Across from McCarran airport off the bustling Sunset Rd, you can find fresh authentic middle eastern food. A hotspot for lunch attracting locals who work in the area and those who stop for lunch from a bus tour.  I sampled the chicken kabob with warm and freshly baked pita while a friend enjoyed their Philly cheesesteak sandwich. More returns here are planned in my future.

LOVE!! I just love mediterranean food... but then again, I'm half arab, so I kinda have to love mediterranean food. But I wasn't sure if my typical white-boy of a husband would like it, and to my surprise he loved it too. I ordered the chicken shish kabob entree... came with rice, chicken, some spinach thingy, and bread, and I also ordered a side of hummus.... basically more than enough to satisfy my tiny self, but it was all soo good that I just couldn't stop eating. The spinach thing was very flavorful and the chicken was cooked to perfection. I ordered the beef kabob entree for the husband and that also came with rice, spinach and bread. All very good and tasty as well. My mom and brother both got the chicken kubidehs entrees and seemed to enjoy their food as well. It was a little spicy for me, but some people like spicy :)
Staff were nice and friendly(well, the cooks didn't really look thrilled to be there, but then again... whose actually happy to go to work? lol), restaurant was clean and very well-lit environment, and just outside this restaurant is a decent view of the strip. I would absolutely come back here again, and I would definitely love to bring my in-laws here when they come to visit. If my (picky) husband loves it, then I'm sure they will too!

Absolute best Middle Eastern food at budget price! Grilled to order fresh. The combination Koobideh (ground beef) and Chicken Kabob served with Basmati rice with saffron, tomato, unions and freshly made pita bread is the bombiggity!  All for under $10. 4 star dish at fast food pricing. Stop in and see for yourself, you'll become a regular!
Ok guys so I come here quite often! This place is clean and the food is amazing! I have tried a lot on their menu and nothing has ever disappointed me. Highly recommended and their price is right!

Tried this place out for lunch with a friend and as you can tell by my star rating, wasn't too excited about it. The service was friendly, fast and we each had a 20% off coupon so that was nice. I ordered a falafel wrap and my friend got the veggie Kebob plate. The food did not impress me. The falafel wrap had 2 small falafel with some plain chopped lettuce tucked into a pita bread. There was a little bit of a greenish sauce but it was tasteless. My wrap was accompanied by some chopped and seasoned onions as well as a small bit of lettuce greens and a large lemon wedge. THANK GOODNESS FOR THE LEMON WEDGE! I ended up covering my meal in the lemon juice to give it some flavor. My meal was far from awful but was very bland and compared to their competitor down the street...no question, I will not be switching Falafel places. While I did not try the veggie Kebob it did not impress my friend enough to go back a second time.

Fresh and delicious ingredients. Could not believe they had Saffron in shakers for a fast food place. You usually find this in an upscale restaurant.

They even serve shirazi salad, Mast-O-Khiar, Mast-o-Musir, baba ghanoush, dolmeh and tabouli.

Price point is unbelievable for the quality. There is vegetarian options as well.

This place has really good gyros. And their seasoned fries are awesome too. Their pita bread is really unique, probably because it's Naan bread and not typical of the bread which I've had gyro meat on mostly in my life. Their cuts of gyro are super meaty - no thin slices here, so they're super-filling with just five or six hunks of beef and lamb. Definitely heading back to this place. Service probably could have been nicer, but, with all of Greece's recent austerity measures, and their crappy soccer teams of late, I cut 'em some slack.

I never write  on here but today I was really pissed. I eat here a couple of times a week
and have told people its a great lunch place. But today the service sucked!!!. The girl behind the counter gave me such shit and argued  with me about giving me a tiny sample size of yogurt. I have requested every once in awhile and get for free,. I was told it would be a dollar after she rang my card and I had gave her a $2 tip for ringing me up!!! I said to the owner I have never taken their" buy 6 meals get a free one" deal.. I must have 20 coming to me. All I wanted was a little yogurt on my plate. The way he threw it on my plate and looked at me just pissed me off. I finish my meal which was great and  I threw a dollar on his counter. Any said in very petty snotty way " Here's your dollar"  He just glared at me. 
I will not be eating there any more or for a long time.  You can kiss my a@#$. Its petty bullshit. Its too bad you will lose a faithful customer and someone who brings people all the time to your business for a scoop of yogurt!

Eh, we were excited to get in and have some kabob, as we usually have it at least once a week, and we couldn't get any while we were down in Cabo. Apparently our excitement was premature, because the food was not as impressive as expected. The rice lacked any flavor and I'm pretty sure they just tossed it from the bag into a pot of boiling saffron water and didn't use any spices, which is super weird for Middle Eastern style rice. On top of that, my boyfriend wanted a chicken and lamb kabob, and asked for a chicken plate and to just pay for the lamb kabob, and the girl said she can't sell just the kabobs, so she conned him into buying two full meals for himself. I didn't think his lamb shish or chicken shish was as good as my kubideh combo plate of ground chicken and a ground lamb kabob, which is weird because shish kabobs are usually way better, but they don't use much spices in their kitchen here. The portions are very large, and we had a lot of leftovers to take, but we wish the leftovers had more flavor to them than what we had last night.
Do NOT expect your catering order to be complete OR for them to deliver what they've missed at all.. no apologies & the worst customer service.
They would only take 36 off for the $40 yelp deal? Floor was sticky and food was standard. I would not go back nothing special.

We were looking for the old flamed grill but it was replaced with Fresh Kabob. Service was good. Food was delicious except for one dish that we didn't like. Other than that, everything else YUMMY & Halal.

Solid 4-5 stars deserved imo. I enjoyed my visit and will be back.

You order at the counter and use a fountain machine so not much for service after you order but I did get good service while ordering.

They said they make the soup daily and gave me a sample without asking. Great service. From the first sip of the sample of the soup I knew I'd like the food. 

Soup was very good and you get a big portion,  5 star
Small salad was good, 4.5 star considering price and toppings
Chicken Karahi was good value and tasty. Good spicy kick with good bread and salad to sooth the sting. 

I gotta drop a star because the ordering line is not the best. The have seating close to the cashier and I was standing little to close to a couple that was eating. I also got cut in line since they have a door right there also besides the main door. 

For the price and flavor I am happy to give them a 4 - 4.5 star. Check them out. Enjoy!
Great coustmor service and delicious food always fresh and healthy food I never had any complaints best Mediterranean in Las Vegas I highly recommend this place to all local and tourist.

I have been here several times and have absolutely loved it everytime. The food is excelent and the staff is very friendly. I've had the gyro and the #5 Chicken Kabob multiple times and they are always good.The chicken is cooked perfectly and is well seasoned and oh so juicy. The gyro was so large that I couldn't pick it up or finish it, however, the Chicken shish kabob seems small for the $9 price tag. This is the ONLY reason I didn't give them 5 stars. Although the food is very good, it's hard to pay $9 for 5 to 6 bites of chicken. Regardless of the portion size I will definitely continue to eat here because the food is just that good. Once you try it, you WON'T forget it. Someday, I hope to try the lamb and beef kabobs ... if I could only get past the chicken!

I had lunch here this afternoon to celebrate a coworker's birthday. The food itself was fantastic. Each member of our party commented on how delicious the food itself was. However, the service was less than stellar. One of our table's orders came out at least 20 minutes after everyone else . Then, when I went up to buy some extra orders of bread for the table, I was told that "we are too busy to make bread for you right now." As strange as this seems, if this is the case I recommend that the manager on duty removes the sign reading "Buy Fresh Bread" from the order window. 
Sad to leave a 3 star review when the food was so delicious but we were very disappointed in the service.

I like this place. Big salad with your meal with a couple of kabobs and rice. The bread is good as well. Food tastes good, feels healthy, and very fresh. I always get to 2 kabob special. Leave full n happy. Not a very heavy meal, but filling. That good kind of full were you ate well, ate enough, and feel good about what you ate.

My family always comes back to this place for its great food and cleanliness. The price is reasonable on some items. It's a given that for 1 person you would have to spend at least $20 for a main, a side, drink and possibly a desert (their Baclava is sometimes very good sometimes decent). In a group, costs a lot less because you can share items. Their food taste great, they kinda cut back on stronger flavors that way you can enjoy a fresher tasting food.

I highly recommend their Baba Ghanoush which is served with fresh Pita bread. In terms of flavor of meat, I would get the lamb followed by the chicken and lastly the beef (for some reason the beef has the least amount of flavor).

Came here on a Wednesday evening with my cousin for some dinner. I ordered #11 and she ordered the special. She's been here quite a few times and I haven't... so after hearing her rave about it I decided to give it a shot.

Wow, am I a fan! Their chicken kubideh is on point and their chicken kabob was super tender, juicy, and flavorful! I substituted the rice for fries (because honestly, I'm middle eastern and I'm tired of eating rice haha). The only thing I can say about the food is that I paid nearly $20 for the #11, a drink, and the garlic sauce. Granted you get bread, a small salad (which was just a bunch of greens on top of some onions), and a grilled tomato... I still felt like it was a bit much. I mean maybe its the setting that throws me off because if you were to go to cheesecake factory it would probably be the same cost if not more. Maybe because it is a smaller restaurant, I was expecting cheaper prices. Regardless, the flavor of the food along with its freshness had me happy so no worries there. And that garlic sauce!!! So good!!

The only reason why I wanted to take a star off (but decided not to) is because the girl that took our order REALLY looked like she hated her job. I don't know if it was a long day for her or what, but I felt like she really wanted to go home lol. Also, the food took a long time to come out even though we were only 2 of 4 total customers in the restaurant.

On a side note, the view of the airport and watching the aircraft landing/taking off was a definite plus (especially for me since I fly and am an aviation junkie). 

I will definitely be back for more! Food was great, along with the views!

Christmas day, driving into Vegas, and we have a couple of hours before catching our flight out of town. We are in the mood for kebabs, and our usual "go-to" place is closed. Proximity to the airport and decent reviews wins the family vote for our travel day Xmas meal. 
When you enter, you proceed to the counter to place your order. We ordered a good sampling of menu items - A plate of mixed kebabs - chicken and beef kubideh kebab platter with rice and mixed salad greens, a plate of chicken kahari, mantu meat dumplings, eggplant bademjan, and a side of mast-o-musir.
Interestingly, the menu offerings represent a variety dishes from several close yet distinct cultures. Mantu meat dumplings are more of an Afghani food, while kubideh kebabs, eggplant bademjan and mast-o-masir are all classic Persian offerings. Finally, chicken kahari is traditionally a dish of Pakistani origin. 
For the Persian offerings, the chicken kubideh kebab was delicious- balanced in seasonings, and moist. They were so good that we ordered another 2 chicken kebabs at the end of the meal to take with us on the plane, but somehow managed to eat them before even leaving the restaurant. The beef kebab had a bit of an "off" or sour taste, almost as if the beef was a day or two beyond the expiration date. We would not order the beef kebab again. The eggplant bademjan was well fried and served with a generous amount of olive oil, with a nice drizzle of a mild garlicy yogurt. This is a tasty appetizer best shared by at least 3 or more people as it quite heavy if you plan to eat any thing else. the mast-o-musir was perfect: thick creamy yogurt elevated with shallots and mint. The perfect compliment to the kebabs.
The mantu dumplings were acceptable, but the outer pasta-like dumpling shell was crisp . At other Afghani restaurants, the dumpling shell is served traditionally as soft - like al dente pasta. We would probably not order this item again. These dumplings were filled with ground beef, served on a bed of lentils and covered in a mild yogurt sauce. 
Finally, the Pakistani dish, chicken Karahi, was the surprise entree of the whole meal. It was as good as any accomplished Pakistani home cook would make. Chunks of chicken bathed in a savory, rich, tomato based sauce softly blanked with the typical tapestry of spices used in Pakistani cooking, and complimented with bell peppers and onions. 
The pita / naan served with most of the entrees is soft and fresh. 
Note that at the end of the counter where you order, is a dispenser for a classic green Afghani sauce that goes well with the kebabs. It is a mildly spicy cilantro-vinegar based sauce. There is a sign that tells you "one per order" and there are micro-containers into which the sauce can be dispensed. It is an addicting sauce- but the management does not need to appear  so ungenerous with the sign and tiny containers. Do they mean once little container for a big order with multiple plates? One little container per person?
Overall, this restaurant is fast, casual, provides generous portions, moderate prices, along with a multicultural variety of offerings. The chicken kubideh kebabs, mast-o-masir, and chicken kahari all warrant a return visit!

1. A shorter review than normal due to time constraints.

2. It was very good, a 3.8 or 3.9, rounded to a 4 for star rating purposes. The food is Persian food, think Iranian, if that makes it easier to understand the geographical aspect from which the food is derived.

3. The YELP coupon, pay $20 for $40, was certainly a bonus.

4. First, being situated across from the runway at McCarran IAP in full view of the departing and arriving aircraft was a great visual treat, particularly at dusk. That added to the very clean, well-lit, self-service restaurant in the small strip mall across the street.

5. Now for the food! Very good stuff. We each enjoyed a kabob, one chicken, one beef, and both were normal portion size, and tasty. Both served with a different type of rice, and flatbread nan. We also had a small, locally packaged salad, again, good, and unique tasting in a positive way.

6. For dessert, we had a pre-packaged pistachio ice cream cup that was great and unique.

7. As for service, the gentleman that took our order from behind the counter was simply excellent and accomodating at every point - refreshing to experience. In fact, he helped us approach and maximize our coupon to hit very near the $40 coupon we purchased.

8. We recommend it.

I LOVE THIS PLACE !! BEST FOOD! Chicken and beef are my favorite ! So flavorful ! And rice and bread ! Soo yummy !! I come all the time ! Never let me down 

*But cashier girls need to smile more and be more happy :( I just want to give her flowers just to see a smile , she looks so miserable :(

Such great food. Hubby and I came here with a serious craving for shish kabob and Fresh Kabob did not disappoint. We ordered stuffed grape leaves, a chicken combo, and a falafel wrap. 

The stuffed grape leaves were perfect. Most places have it where it's too soggy. Their grape leaves were amazing and seasoned very well. 

My husband got #11, a chicken shish kabob and kubideh plate. The kubideh was our favorite, it had so much flavor and was nice and tender. The shish kabob was also very good.

Falafel plate was good as well! Their falafel is the best I've had so far here in town. 

Come visit this place, the owner Hamid is very friendly and customer service is really good. The food is freshly cooked and very flavorful!
Whenever we are in Las Vegas we go eat at Fresh Kabob great food nice tender Chicken Kabobs and basmati rice the sauces excellent.
Not bad, but it's more fast food than Persian restaurant. Still good for the low wait time and decent kabob.
New to the city and decided try this place and OMG is it delicious! I had the philly steak meal. Good eats..was a little of a wait due to it was made fresh. Will be back!!
Their gyros are my favorite! Kabobs are delicious and well seasoned too. Kids love their chicken tenders. They never fail to satisfy our Mediterranean food cravings!

We ordered delivery (shocking!) and it arrived in a timely fashion, nice and hot. Husband got beef shish and lamb kubideh. He enjoyed the lamb, but thought the beef was over-cooked. Not very tender and no pink. At all. Zilch.

I ordered a chicken shish and kubideh. Both were good, although the kubideh is WAY better in my opinion. Very tasty and tender. 

The rice is good, albeit slightly bland. The pita bread/nan was very good. 

It would be great if they offered more of an a la carte menu, but other than that it was pretty much what we expected. 

I would order here again, but mainly because it's the only other delivery option aside from Thai, pizza and Chinese...

You guys.  I'm disappointed.  I went to Fresh Kabob after seeing all the awesome reviews, and it totally didn't pan out.

Here's the deal.  We ordered a gyro and a wrap, along with some hummus.  Dude behind the counter was nice, but for some reason he only talked to me (even though my husband was also talking to him), and he called the gyro a "j-eye-row."

The hummus came out first, and we started to chow down.  After a couple bites, I looked at my husband and asked how he liked it.  I asked because it tasted like...air.  Like nothing.  It looked like hummus, it felt like hummus, but it didn't taste like anything.  He thought about it and said "it couldn't be blander."  So, the hummus was a bust.

When our food came out, we were pleasantly surprised.  The meat in both was good--though extremely salty--and flavorful.  It was a nice contrast to the lifeless hummus, but I definitely think that it was a tad overpriced.

Overall, we agreed that we wouldn't be coming back.  It wasn't the worst thing ever, but it definitely didn't meet our expectations.  We eat out a lot, and it is always a bummer to spend money on a meal that is just meh.

We have been coming here since the place opened to get our Persian food "fix" - sometimes even twice a week!! While we have tried a TON of other kabob places here in town, this by far surpasses the quality and quantity of them all... I usually get the sirloin kabob which is flame broiled and seasoned to perfection each time.  My husband gets the beef kubideh special & of course, it's bomb!!  The saffron rice has a unique buttery flavor and is firm and delicious.  Veggie kabobs are again seasoned perfectly, juicy and just grilled enough to not be mushy.  The mast-o-kihar is by far my favorite and the bread u get to dip it in is fluffy, warm and made to order - just like everything else.  

When you eat at fresh kabob, u get fine-dining quality food at counter service prices! And to top it off? The staff and management are always attentive, friendly, and eager to correct any issues you may have on-the-spot.  Highly recommend fresh Kabob... You're welcome! ;)
Loved this place. we be back for sure. Very authentic. The combo we ordered was delicious and had to order another dish go try and got the chicken kabob. It was juicy and tender.
Fresh, inexpensive, quality kabobs. Great place if you need a quick quality meal before catching a flight or if you want to escape the strip.

Great food but don't call for delivery.  I spent over 10 mins for a very simple order to someone who barely spoke English. When it came to giving her my card number and and address she totally screwed it up.  I ended up canceling my order.  Very painful experience.  Use a food delivery service.

Really happy I stopped into this place. The food is grilled fresh to order w big portions. I got the beef shish and been kubideh combo and it came w pita, rice, grilled tomato, lemon wedge and onions. It's a complete meal w all the fixins :D

My favorite kabob place in town!! Love how authentic all the meat tastes. I switch between the 2 kubideh special and lamb gyro and honestly if my stomach allowed it, I'd get both dishes. Favorite part about the gyro is how thin the lamb is and the white sauce they add. I normally do the chicken and lamb kubideh which is ground meat. It turns out really tender and with the rice and roasted tomato it is absolute perfection. They just recently started giving a sauce on the side and all I can say is I love the place even more!

This is not original Persian food. I could tell from the smell. I think the restaurant changed ownership. I was here 3 months ago and the food I ordered was authentic. Go elsewhere. Go to any Persian restaurant in LA you will see the difference.
Very slow service. We are on a quick lunch break and are waiting a LONG time for our food! It better be tasty!
Food was ok, portions were small and it was a bit pricey.  Stephano's is way better.  They were going to get 3 stars but they serve Pepsi and that's just nasty so only gets 2 stars.

This spot is consistent and always spot-on. I run here on my way home from work and enjoy a chicken kabob on the run. Everything I super tasty, including whatever that delicious green sauce is. Keep in mind, everything is fresh to order and it takes a little time so have a few minutes to spare.
My favorite joint when I come to vegas for training/business.  By far the best kabob spot in the area.
Food is delicious. I dream about their rice lol decent portions. Clean environment. The manager is the sweetest!! Friendly staff. Will come back.

Very very good Greek! The home made pita was amazing! I got the gyro thinking I won't eat much of the pita to save the carbs but one taste and I knew that concept was out the window! I gave 4 stars only because the rice wasn't my favorite but it's ok. Other than that, everything we got was really good! I'm glad we found this place. I recently learned I was allergic to beef, so the lamb gyro is a great substitute
Moist flavorful delicious kabobs. Not too much else to say about this place. Spent about 25 bucks for two people and it was well worth the price!!

3.5 stars.  I love the food at Fresh Kabob and have been coming here since they opened (as Flame Kabob).  Back in the Flame days I would have given them 5 stars, but in the years since ownership changed hands, it's not quite the same.  There is inevitably a super long wait time, whether the place is empty or full, and there is always some issue. A couple of times the soda machine was down, once they were out of taftoon bread, once out of chicken, once there was no furniture (I think this was a dispute with the previous owner).  Just always something irritating.  The wait time, coupled with the issues knocked my rating down on this $10-15 counter order establishment.

I generally order the Chicken Shish meal for $9 and a friend and I share the mast-o-khiar $2.5 (cucumber and mint yogurt dip), but today I went for the Chicken Karachi $7 because the picture shows a bunch of veggies and didn't want rice (their rice is so good, but so bad for me!).  The meal I got didn't really look like the picture.  I didn't have many veggies and I did not care for their sauce.  I will likely be back, but ordering the old standby!

This place NEVER disappoints!!! I always get the ground beef and chicken kabobs (kupidehs) with rice and a side of bread.  This used to be Flame Kabob and just changed the restaurant name.  The kabobs are super tasty and large amount of meat for just one.  Usually me and the bf share a plate with a side of bread and order a side of the yogurt to dip the food in.  The green sauce (do not know the name) is also a tasty condiment and can be used to add a little spicy hot to it.  The rice is soft, fluffy and moist.  The bread is made by hand over this hot table grilley thing and super fresh.  The best persian food I have had and the price is decent!! Sometimes the food takes a little while but it's totally worth the wait!! Everytime I go, consistently good food!!

Fresh is the perfect name for this place! I can't say enough good things about the freshness and flavor of the food here. They make the bread right in front if you as you order it...it's to die for! The kubidehs are full of authentic Mediterranean flavors, veggies are crisp and generously portioned, and the rice is the best I've ever had. The people are friendly and the atmosphere is upbeat, open, bright and inviting. Make sure you try the mast-o-musir for a real authentic treat.

So I'll start by saying the food is good, but it's hard to enjoy their food. The lady working the front register is a megabitch to everyone and then there's random homeless people bathing in their bathrooms and leaving the doors unlocked for unsuspecting patrons to walk in on them. 

As I sat trying to enjoy a lunch with my friend I watched not one, but 4 different men try to go in to use the restroom and instead end up with shocked and disgusted looks on their faces as they walked away. I assume they were bathing as they kept coming back out of the restroom dripping wet...but I can't be sure. At least two of these shocked men confronted megabitch at the counter who promptly dismissed them and never attempted to check on what was happening a mere 10 feet from her. Safe to say I won't be eating here again.

I ordered the Mantu and it was the most disgusting thing I've ever eaten. Mantu are supposed to be soft/pasta-style dumplings, but what I was served was fried samosa-style dumplings. The lentils on the top were hard as a rock. The meat was tasteless and under-seasoned. We also ordered kabobs which were way too salty. They should call them "salt-kabobs". I threw away half the food because it was so disgusting. The Owners are apparently not Afghan and definitely should not have Afghan food on their menu because they have no idea what the hell they are doing.

Wanted a gryo while on a vegas vacation. Didnt want to deal with the strip. Now...I have this gyro place in seattle, been there over 30 yrs, family owned and had what I thought was the best gyros ever, until now!  Very flavorable and oh so tender and the fries were off the hook hot crisp and seasoned perfect! $7 for a gyro and fry platter. Little strip mall spot south of the airport in the middle of nothing. Glad I listened to yelp reviews and came!

It's hit or miss here sometimes the service is great the place is clean and the food outstanding other times the service is poor, it's filthy including sticky tables and the food only just edible.  I think if they would be more consistent this would be a great place to eat!

This used to be Flame Kabob but they have since changed their name to Fresh Kabob.  But everything still tastes the same to me. 

I love their chicken and beef kubidehs; packed with lots of flavor.  When I grab lunch from here, I scarf it down quite fast when I get back to work.  It really is that good.  My ultimate favorite side here is the Baba Ghanoush!  OMG!  I can't get enough of it, you can really taste the eggplant like it's been roasted.  Yum!

I love this place and come here at least once a week for a fresh lunch.

Too far from my house but I always wanted to try this kabob restaurant 
I got #1 combinations and my husband got #3
The prices were very reasonable. For 2 people was just $18 come with rice veg and meat ! 
The reason why I have 4 stars is Lamb was little dry 
But I'll definitely come back to get kabob

The food is so delicious  The best Mediterranean I've had so far. The garlic sauce is amazing! 
The delivery guy was very nice, and delivered to our room, even when I told him I could pickup in the lobby. So nice of him 
The only problem I had was that, since I order delivery to my room in Las Vegas , they forgot to add forks, and napkins. But their restaurants and service was excellent

I tried this place for the first time recently and I was instantly hooked. The food is fresh, delicious and super high quality. These kabobs are fresh and super tasty. The chicken is all white meat chicken breast and the steak is very, very high quality beef. The seasonings are just right -- not too spicy for a normal palate yet packed with flavor. Make sure you get a side of their homemade green sauce, it is killer good. 

The freshly baked naan-style bread is amazing. I could gobble it up plain but I like to stack my meat on top so it soaks up the juices. Since I am a low carb eater, I didn't try the rice but instead got a side salad. It, too, consisted of simple yet high quality ingredients. They only have one housemade salad dressing that's exotic and very fresh tasting. This isn't a place to go if you are in a rush, they really do cook everything to order so it can take about 15 minutes to get your dinner.

The main dining room is nothing special but is decorated with pretty granite tables and there's even a nice couch seating area. There are a few tables outside on a small patio that afford gorgeous views of McCarran's runway so you can watch planes take off and land while you eat. The restaurant is located in a nondescript shopping strip center amongst office buildings and gets super popular during the workday; go in the evening or on the weekend for less crowds. 

There are three main problems I have with this place. One, the prices are just too high. I know fresh, made-to-order food costs money, but when I have to shell out nearly $40 for two of us to eat a light dinner at a quick service restaurant, that's really hitting me in my pocketbook! The portion sizes are out of whack with the prices; the portions are pretty small yet still expensive. I had to order TWO kabobs to fill me up.

Two, the overuse of styrofoam sends a bad message. Why trash our environment more by using ALL styrofoam? Surely there's a more eco-friendly way to plate your food! Styrofoam containers are so 1980, get with the modern times. People do care about our environment and responsible business owners should too. 

Third, the employees can be a little off-putting. It was my first time in and the guy taking my order seemed less than thrilled to have me as a guest. As I sat waiting for my food, several other patrons came in and told the guy behind the counter that it was their first time and even asked for recommendations. The employee said, very bruquesly, that he didn't know what they would like and offered ZERO help to these poor people. That's a sure way to make sure people NEVER set foot in your restaurant again.

I absolutely love the food here and the quality and taste of my meal outweighed all of the negatives, thus resulting in my 4 star review.

Nice restaurant with good food,
The place located right next to the airport so you can see airplanes flying while you eat.
The food are very affordable and it does taste good, the only thing I didn't like is there hummus I mean it was okay but doesn't taste like others that I tried before.

So... Let me say this; my husband and I come here often.. We LOVE LOVE LOVE the food!! Meat is always good, and never have any complaint at all!! UNTIL TODAY!! WE WOULD NEVER come back here EVER AGAIN!! So what makes today so different right? So came in like usual, order beef and lamb kabob plate with rice and salad like we always do. This time though we asked for extra rice and bread! Girl in the cashier said yes! That was it and we paid! So when the order came out we checked like we always do and wonder where is my extra rice?? And of course I asked.. So the cook (Hispanic man that probably doesn't speak English) just laugh and kept saying you need to pay extra you need to pay extra keep repeating same thing like broken record 10times. So I called the cashier girl and she said yes she put it on the order for extra rice and the cook 10more times said go pay..go pay while laughing!! So unprofessional and will never ever come back to this place ever again! If I can give them negative stars I would!!

Has never dined in there so this review is solely based for their take out... we mostly order chicken tenderloin, chicken kabob, rose ice cream...the pita bread is delicious and i dont know the name but one of the creamy sauce is to die for...i really didnot like their hummus but the rest of the dishes are really good...also the chicken shawarma is to die for... treat your sweet tooth with their yummy baklava

Best kabobs and bread in town!
The meat is tender, juicy, and oh so flavorful. The bread is fresh and tasty. Just love this place!
I was pleasantly surprised at how good this place is. The rice is delicious, and their homemade pita bread & hummus is next level! Delivery was very quick as well. Definitely eating here again.

I'm really confused at the positive reviews here. We just had takeout from here and the one word that describes my whole meal perfectly was... DRY. 

I received flavorful yet very dry ground beef kebab on top of the driest rice I've ever had. Garnished with a "salad" that was nothing more than spring mix laid next to my food. Why even add this "salad" to the dish if you're going to do nothing but take it from the container and plop it on the food. Was it just for the added color? 

I received a large lemon wedge which I guess is their idea of how you're supposed to moisten up there dry meal. Problem is they don't deseed their lemons before they give it to you. I had to use my finger and dig out eight lemon seeds from my lemon wedge. Yes you read that right 8 lemon seeds! Thankfully I don't dislike lemon so it did help make this meal tolerable but for the folks that don't like lemon this would not be a great meal. They really should offer some sort of sauce to help out their dry meat, dry rice, dry salad greens.

They also forgot to put the tomato in my to go box that I see is advertised on other pictures. 

The only highlight of the meal was their bread, it was outstanding. But I don't come to kebab places for their bread. Unfortunately I will not be back.

The service was fast, meat portion of the order was on the smaller side for the price you pay, bread was good, food was very bland almost no flavor, there are much better options in Vegas for this type of food, don't think I'll be back to this place again. Had higher expectations but was let down.
Lunch buffet was excellent. Great service, fresh food, and nice atmosphere. Lots of vegetarian options. Great price and live music was cool too. I will go back.

This is a good lunch option if you are in the area. I've dined in the restaurant and ordered carryout for a work lunch.
