On my first visit I ordered a Beef Kabob plate. I really liked the beef kabob and I liked the saffron rice as well. The veggies on the side were good too. The only thing missing was maybe a small hummus or cucumber sauce side for dipping the pita bread. 

My second experience was ordering takeout for a work lunch. Placing an order for 10 was easy and ready in 25-30 minutes. They have many reasonably priced meals which made it easy to stay within T&E limits for our lunch. All of our orders were correct and everyone enjoyed their meals. The only room for improvement was on the way they packaged some of the to go orders. There were large skewers stabbed through the takeout boxes from top to bottom. When we removed them to separate the to go containers we ended up with leaking juices due to the holes in the bottom of the containers.

The Shredded Chicken Wrap was my choice for my work lunch. I liked the variety in this meal. It included a yummy grape leaf, hummus, and sauce for the wrap. The flavor on the chicken was good and I liked the flavor of the chicken and sauce together. It was very messy though.

Overall, a great lunch spot. The menu is large and offers a nice variety of plates and wraps. I like the variety of meats offered too. Pricing is very reasonable.
the chicken is great. I rather eat ground beef at different places.

I'm 1/2 MIddle Estrn & this place came recommended to me by my uber driver! I decided to use Uber Eats to order it! It was fast delivery & great price. CONS: Strike #1: no silverware, fries didn't come with ketchup & chicken kabob didn't have any sauce or garlic sauce i'm used to. Strike #2: the chicken was tough to bite into & under cooked in the center
PROS: Chicken seasoning was perfect otherwise. Love the warm, soft chewy bread & Salmon was super tasty & perfectly cooked. Interesting touch hummus garnished with blk olives ontop! Next time i'll just go for the shawarama lamb/beef meat I like best anyway!
Wonderfully fresh ingredients and a great value!  Would definitely recommend it! My only suggestion would be to turn up the flavor on the shirazi salad.

Wow!! I came into town and my mom and I went Tux fitting and this place was down the street and caught our eye. The food was superb and definitely a great healthy alternative to the other food locations in the area. I got the chicken kabob and hummus. We ate outside and the food came out quick and it tasted amazing. The spices on the chicken is a recipe I would love to steal and make in my own home. We sat outside in their lush outdoor seating with a 1 year old and we all loved our selections. I can't wait to go back, but they should open other locations in the Vegas valley area.

This place is UH-MAZING! and super addicting...
My boyfriend and I have been coming here frequently since we moved to this side of town in September. The food is always great, wait time for the food is usually 10-15 minutes but thats okay just as long as it fresh! I usually order the Tenderloin Beef Shish Kabob for $8.99 it comes with a grilled juicy tomato, some lettuce, bread, and Saffron rice. The Saffron rice is great, super colorful, and slightly buttery. The Tenderloin is very tender, juicy and grilled to perfection with a tiny bit of that burnt grilled crust for extra flavor. It's all great. The only reason why I had to give 4 stars is because I feel the customer service has slightly gone down, maybe management has changed or something. Also one time, the manager blocked me in my space for 10 minute while he nonchalantly parked behind me so that he could chat with the delivery guy!

I come here probably once a month or so for lunch. I keep coming back because the food is good, but I always dread the service! You have to call multiple times before someone picks up the phone to place an order, there have been multiple front counter girls and somehow each one is ruder than the previous one. If you ate looking for good food to go then come here, if you want to actually enjoy your lunch experience and have someone smile at you, go to Crazy Pita! (I would go there but it's a few more miles away and always crazy busy during lunch!)

We ordered food from here last night and it was just ok.  All the meats seemed to be over cooked and dried out.  

The falafel was hard and dry, the Gyro meat was just ok, over cooked, I don't know if it was just because it was evening or what, but the food was not impressive enough to make us want to go back.  The prices are very reasonable, but the cheap price kind of matches the over over cooked food.

The portions of food are large on the rice and pita bread, but very skimpy on dishes with fries and ok on meats, if it only tasted better.

At some point we may give this place another try but it is not a place we will rush back too.
Had the Mantu and the Chicken Karahi. Both dishes are unusual to have on the menu for a mediterranean / Kabob restaurant, but we were very happy with our food. Place can be a little loud with TV etc.
Worst service by far! As soon as I walked in no one greeted me, all I got was rude stares. The woman at the register was very rude. So I kindly said "thank you" and took my business else where!

It's hard to find good kabob when you often get the homemade version, but I was really disappointed with the quality of ground beef. The meat was too rich and greasy and didn't have a good flavor. The babaganoush was very oily as well.

I stopped here completely on impulse to try something new and I'm so glad I did. I had the beef tenderloin kabob and a side of tabbouleh that was DELICIOUS.  It took a little longer to get the food than I thought  it would but worth the wait, will return soon and frequently!
This place is awesome for a quick bite. Love their combo and the food is guaranteed to be amazing
Stole my money! Charged me for delivery and never delivered! still trying to get my money back!

The food here is very delicious. 
I ordered the Chicken plate #5. My daughter ordered the Chicken Sharwarma and my other daughter ordered the chicken strips with fries which were really good also.
Love that they have the garlic cream sauce stuff. 
The owners or employees could be a little friendlier but I get it.
Extremely friendly staff... Delicious fresh food, abundant quantities... Great atmosphere... Reasonable prices... Definitely recommend to anyone who wants great food, service and price!

Went on Sunday night and used the Yelp deal $20 for $40. Super easy and it is a great deal! Our family ordered a mix of chicken and beef kubideh plates that come with a super yummy rice, grilled tomato, salad greens and bread.... ooooohhh the bread! Everything was so yummy! Place is super clean and owner is very nice! Right next to the airport so after dinner we watched planes land and take off from the airport tarmac. We will definitely be back when we visit Las Vegas again next summer!
Very tasty and fresh kabob, comes with rice and freshly baked pita bread. Also, nice view of the Airport runway.

We were eating here on and off very often in the past few years. Location is either convenient or inconvenient, it depends on my daily routine.
Well, since I don't visit the post office next door very often, and I don't live on that side of the city either, I don't usually make a detour for Kabob.
Surprisingly the dining room area is bigger than it looks like from the outside. There are some comfortable couches to sit down while waiting for To Go orders.
They have fountain drinks for $1.99, or a variety of other beverages in the refrigerator from $1.49 and up.
Daily special was $11.99, three different meats (beef, chicken and lamb Shish kabobs) with rice.
This time we ordered: 
Gyro with French fries.
Very little meat inside pita bread, lots of iceberg lettuce with sauce, and french fries. It was tasty.
Tenderloin Chicken Shish kabob on the platter with saffron rice, garnished with onions and some green leafs and grilled tomatoes. Freshly made, chicken was very tender and tasty. 
I watched them making my dinner through the glass!
We also ordered cheese cake.
Desserts are not made on promises, some outside company supplies it! (I think Manan)
Overall it's a good place to grab a tasty meal for a decent price.

If you are in a hurry, think twice! Kabobs need about 12 minutes to be grilled!

Visited for lunch,

Menu was pretty standard meterterain  cuisine (Kabobs & Koobideh). Prices were very reasonable  (about $10 per person)

I ordered the beef Koobideh & Chicken shish kabob, hummus and pistachio ice cream.

Came out pretty quick. Flavors were good and the meat was well cooked. Enjoyed the meal and will be back next time i am in town.

Only drawback is the seating. It is setup very tight.  Once it got busy, people were having to get out of thier chairs to let other people out or to get through for refills or condiments.
Food was Awesome, Delivery time wasnt that bad. Defiantly eating here again.

Amazing delivered it 25 bucks for 3 people an it was delivered. The French fries were good had spice on them no salt .. nice to put your own if you want any. The sauce had dill in it super delicious. Would order this again.
Good food, great prices for a large portion. The location is very convenient to the airport park n ride.

Came on a Sunday after taking the kids to Kangamoo. First in line to order and still waited 40 minutes for our food. We watched several customers leave without getting their food and it was just ridiculous how other customers actually got their food before we did. When my wife asked what was going on, the lady behind the counter just unapologetically said "well I got one of them here" and handed my wife a plate. We had ordered 3 dishes...

The food was good when we did eventually get it but we probably won't come back.

I love this place! Great portions, legit flavors, always clean. The little girl on register should be doing more than sitting on her phone but everyone is pretty on point. Wish they would open one in Summerlin, I only get to eat here when I'm by the airport. Their green sauce is bomb, forget the stupid take 1 only sign you'll want 2 for sure. 

Would be nice if they cleaned the ceiling (it's fury) and replaced light bulbs. Maintenance guy slacking the little stuff like missing paint is starting to really show. Simple day or two of making things perfect doesn't cost anything. Someone is being cheap or lazy.

Eat here for sure!

This place is dirty, the food flavorless, very unintelligent and rude staff and straight hopeless and can't see this place be open for too long. If I was able to rate it Zero stars I would have. Meditterenean food suppose to be flavorful yet nothing had any flavor and so I asked for salad dressing and I was told it would cost a $1.00, then I asked for yogurt sauce and I was charged another $3 and of course, no friggin flavor. I was so mad that I wanted to throw the food away but kids were hungry. I spent $45 for trash. I didn't eat my almost $17 plate and hope they choke on it. Whoever rated this place good,  obviously has no taste.

I really like Kabob Grill for a casual, unhurried lunch. It is very popular, very small, and they cook your food to order, so I do not like it when in a rush. It once took me 20 minutes of a 1 hour total lunch from the point when I ordered to when I got my food...so not the best if time is of the essence. 

But the food is so good, and the prices are even better, so I go back whenever I have time and a small group. Best part about the food? You can taste the smoke and flame. Mmmm

This by far has been my favorite Kabob restaurant locally. The meat was fresh, juicy and flavored just right! Their rice was good and if you sprinkle or dowse it with Sumac (I believe that's what it's called) it's a purple-like spice, it makes the rice 10x better! Enjoy!

What a wonderful and delicious meal this was! I saw this place drivin passed it one day and decided to go with my family for dinner that week. We ordered the chicken and beef shish. The chicken was moist and flavored perfectly. The beef was the star of the meal. Cooked to prefection and was perfect in every way. The other killer things on the menu are the saffron rice and housemade bread. My kids loved the rice most of all because it comes out tri-colored like candy corn. None of the flavors were too strong, my 3, 10, and 13 year old enjoyed their meals, also. I recommend this place to all that want an authentic persian meal.

really good food ... 
just gotta make sure u'r charged correctly , not that they overcharge but bill just appeared to b  confusing
Everything was delicious, except the rice, and it wasn't bad, just a little bland. Would eat again for sure.
Excellent, flavorful and the fresh flat bread is awesome. Will go back again and again.

I would give no stars if I could. I ordered delivery through Yelp and they go through Eat24. The order minimum is $20 and the delivery fee was said to be $3. When my food arrived, the delivery guy said that the fee is actually $5. He had a printed paper/receipt with it only stating $3, but he said they are going to adjust it. What kind of business is that? I reached out to Eat24 and they said the restaurant cannot do that so it's strictly shadiness on behalf of the restaurant. My house isn't far from the restaurant either. Its less than one mile but I was carless and it's the middle of summer.

Now let's talk about the food. I ordered the gyro and the meat inside my gyro is burnt to a crisp. Worse gyro I have ever had. I've been to Yanni's and the Great Greek and had great experiences. Never ever will I order or eat from here again. I drive by this place all the time and have been wanting to try it. I wish I didn't.

Wow, I just opened my second order which is supposed to be the chicken shish kabob and it's something breaded and fried! Wow! I'm shocked at this whole experience! I will be taking it back and asking for a refund. I hope it goes well..
Really Yummy food. The staff was OK in service. Environment is that of fast food place. It is not on strip. But worth a trip there.

Hostels the name says it all Fresh Kabob. The kabobs are fresh and tender and delicious. I've tried every one except beef and they were exceptional. EVERY. SINGLE. TIME. On top of there great food and big portions, the people working here are very kind and considerate. Amid took such a pleasure in making my food and he played it so beautifully rather then just throwing it on the plate. I really like this, it shows me that they take pride in what they do and in satisfying their customers. Very laid back atmosphere, chill music is usually playing and they also have free wifi. This is def my go to spot you know it's good when your getting constant cravings. Lentil soup is also exceptional. A must try this place!

This is probably the worst kebab food I have ever eat, the food was overcooked with no flavor also the beef taste like a low quality beef, I would highly recommend you go try some other place like grand kebab, hope this review was helpful to everyone.

This was the worst Shawarma I ever tried. Customer service was fine so two stars for that. But the meat was cubed and very very tough and chewy. The dolmas where decent but otherwise we where super unimpressed with our meals. I feel bad to write a bad review but this honestly wasn't very good.
Also my sister ordered the gyro and she didn't feel well the whole evening and next day, pretty sure it was from eating here.

I really like the generous portions that you get. I usually get the eggplant bolani which is a huge serving of eggplant mixed with a savory sauce and  a yogurt-type sauce.  It is served with a small side salad and two gigantic pieces of bread that go very well with the eggplant.  They also have a falafel sandwich for vegetarians but I don't remember ordering it.  I will have to try that another time.  The last time I ordered the eggplant borani (4/11/2018) the dish seemed tastier and prepared differently from the last time I ordered it at least a few months earlier.  The service is friendly, but the dishes take time to prepare and there is usually a line if you come at peak lunch hours, so if you're in a hurry it's best to call ahead.  I just wished they offered more vegetarian main dish choices on the menu--if they did, I would be likely go here much more often as I live only a few miles away.
Food and service were very good. The dining area was lacking cleanliness. They need to be better at cleaning the tables during busy times,but the service  and food was exceptional.

I love this place. The food does takes a little while to cook so I always call ahead and place my order for pick up. To start off the bread is freshly made the meats are always juicy with all the right spices and the rice I so delicious I always end up eating the whole portion and save my husband portion for any leftovers  my all time favorite is the spinach plate for my vegetarian friends. I always get a spinach side and a baba ganoush just delicious

Good food but price wise is a bit expensive. And every move you do they will charge you. I mean if you ask for extra bread for hummus they will charge you. You want garlic sauce they will charge you. I know a good place that served hummus with your meal and free bread refill. 3 star for the prices but service and taste is good.
Great food.  Lamb Shishlik was fresh kobideh tasted good. I will come back. Will recommend for sure

Not only was the food delicious, but the owner and staff are quality people.  I left my purse hanging on the chair when I left and came back about 20 minutes later.  The purse was gone and the staff (who put up with me freaking out) called the owner who came promptly and let me review the video camera.  Long story short, the person who took my purse ended up taking the cash and hiding it in the bathroom and we wouldn't have found that out without the owner's help.  

After finding my purse, I left in a rush to catch my flight (thankfully with my ID) and didn't have a chance to thank the friendly couple and their son who attempted to help me as well.  So, if you're reading this - THANK YOU!

I'll be back to Fresh Kabob next time I'm in LV.  THANK YOU!
My ultimate favorite kabob place! Babaghanoush is so good, and #12 is my favorite meal - that garlic sauce is the best EVER. I love their tiramisu too.

I had fresh kabob cater a lunch for seven people today. They were response, right on time, super nice to work with, and the food was GREAT. It was also a generous amount of food for a nice price point.
Loved it! Fabulous hummus. I had the chicken tenderloin shish and hummus. Best hummus ever. Nice staff too.

I've eaten kabobs all over Vegas but this isn't one of my favorites. The price to portion is good and definitely you'll be full or very satisfied. I was initially really excited because they make fresh teftoon bread. As I've read some of the reviews the kabob was salty actually even the humus was salty. I had ordered the beef soltani and it was a bit dry and salty to my taste. 

The hummus was a bit chunky texture not smooth and full of olive oil like most really good hummus. They also gave you 4 small pieces of bread when you ordered the hummus, you need more bread for the amount of hummus you get, I can tell the hummus was made days before and stored in the fridge. It came in a styrofoam cup and lid and it was cold so they just grabbed it from the fridge. 

There's also some salad on the plate that needed some dressing or something.

Now the bread, I was very excited for the fresh bread they make here but the bread reminded me of a chewy doughy naan without the crispiness. 
It was ok but not great.

Came here based on positive yelp reviews. Left here disappointed. I am middle eastern, I know kabobs! I had a combo plate: chicken, beef tenderloin, half rice/half salad and a yogurt drink. Almost $19!!! NOT cheap and all of which, was mediocre at best. The chicken was a bit dry and seasoned poorly. The tenderloin was tough and chewy, I had to spit some of it out and could not finish it. The salad was weak...not traditional middle eastern salad and skimpy slices of onion. The rice was good. There are much better options for bottled yogurt drinks too. The service was fast food style at best. The owner...or manager...barely looked up while he was frantically counting his money in the register like he was late for a mortgage payment. I had to say hello. Not sure where all these great reviews come from...they can't possibly be coming from middle easterners with love for traditional food! Hope they get their act together because Vegas could use a nice kabob house, but for now...this place is not it! Very disappointed in food and service quality.
The food is pretty delicious, the price is good. But it takes forever to get your order. Very slow staff

This place is amazing. I go there for lunch every other week and it's a delight each time. 
Fresh made bread, long grain basmati rice and perfectly seasoned meat. That's is exactly what Mediterranean food really is. Keep up the good work.

Everything would have been so tasty if it wasn't for excessive saltiness. I like salt but this was extreme.  The chef gave me something else & it was as salty. So if the owner is reading this please please pay attention to this matter, your place is a gem in the desert except for this prob

Ok.  This was second time visiting this restaurant over the past couple of years. My last review was a lot better as I think they did a phenomenal job. This time, not so good. I ordered the lamb kabob. The food was dry and it tasted like it was left overs and got reheated. 

The service was great, very pleasant people.

I will have to say this place is good, and will be returning. My daughter goes to cheer down the street at Elements Cheer and Tumbling.  For a girl you just need to order one kabob. I ordered 2 and it's was way too much ! They wrap the chicken or steak in ceram wrap and let it marinade in the fridge. So they cook it fresh to order! My daughter ordered the shrimp kabob and she loved it !

You don't see that many persian casual food service places.  This place fills that niche.   For less than $10, you can get meat and fluffy (basmati) rice, bread and a roasted tomato.    Fast, easy, a right near the airport, you can't really go wrong if you're in the mood.

Bonus: Free wifi!

I went to Fresh Kabob over the weekend on the recommendation of a friend.  Overall, not a bad experience. The service was relatively quick and you have a nice view of the planes landing at the airport.  The prices are fairly standard for the type of cuisine they serve.  However, the chicken and beef kubideh I ordered had more of a southwest Asian flavor to it whereas I was expecting Persian style food.  The difference is that the Pakistani/Afghani version is spicier as opposed to the Iranian way of preparing the same dish that's not spicy at all.  Although the distinction is subtle, it may be important to some people.  Also, there was no grilled tomato included with the meal, which is a hallmark of Persian kubideh.  The food was still okay.  The rice and naan that came with the kubideh were both good, but people should know that this is not an authentic Persian restaurant.
Nice little kabob place. Gets pretty busy around lunch time. Food is real tasty and the portions are big. Good stuff.

While in vegas I happened upon this place.  Actually pretty good all around, but I couldn't help, but notice that all the help were hispanic.  Not that anything is wrong with that, but shouldn't someone be middle eastern??  cook...supervise??

doubt I will be back.

Fresh Kabob is a great Mediterranean restaurant off the beaten path close to the Vegas airport.  Whenever I'm near sunset park in Vegas I have to stop at Fresh Kabob.  My go to is the chicken Kabob and chicken lule combo with rice and salad.  The bread that comes with the meal is a great addition but be prepared for a lot of carbs.  The grilled whole tomato is a nice touch to the meal.  A must try is the house green sauce that tastes great with pretty much every bite of the meal.  The chicken Kabob and ground chicken skewer are both tender and freshly cooked which makes this one of the best Mediterranean places in town.  Its location would be the only downside since I live a bit away but when I'm craving Kabob and have time for a drive I would chose this place.
3 stars is pretty fair. Had the shawarma combo (number 13) pricing was fair, amount of food is good,  however the quality of food wasnt so good. The meat had no taste. Average eat

My girlfriend and I were so disappointed by this. My chicken was rubbery, her gyro meat was dry and flavorless, my rice looked like cheese, and the pita bread looked and tasted like pizza dough. We were kind of forced into this place because our usual spot is closed on Sunday, but we both said we will go out of our way to never eat here again. This is to help correct the rating this place has. We think it's inaccurate.

This place is bomb! Let me get straight to the point: 
you get plenty of good proteins that, unlike other places, are not super greasy! And their prices are super reasonable. 

I got myself 2 chicken breast skewers, which were perfectly seasoned but not oversalted, juicy, and especially not greasy; it came with rice and I don't really care that others have said it can use seasoning... for me it was perfect the way it was. I do not prefer salt in my dishes. Same for the salad, I got dressing on the side but decided to sprinkle ilt with lemon. And last but not least... their BREAD! Omg! Fluffy but not yeasty or heavy, seasoned but not super salted or fattening ... stayed pretty pretty soft hours after being served... (we took boxes to go)... that was the best pita style bread I have ever had in my whole life. 

In other words, this feels to me an extremely authentic experience and I was so happy I could eat here to complete fullness without having to worry about messing up my macros :))))) 

I will be back again!
This is my first review because this restaurant is so good. Food was delicious . French fries is better than others. Also , restroom is really clean . I think 10/10 !

Kabobs here are bombdigity. Gyros a bit simple than usual but there something about the pita bread that makes it worth the simplicity of the gyro. Service is always super! Food time is est like 10-15 min. Check it out, its good. Prices are sup affordable too. Oh and dont forget the Baklava as dessert. If you don't know what it is. Just know you need to try it. Haha.

I was in LV for work a few weeks oand was famished upon my arrival. Most of the halal options that i found via yelp were closing or closed due to my flight arriving at 9 PM. I was lucky to find this establishment still open thus drove up & looked over the menu. I ordered the hummus and chicken kabob plate. Hummus was grainy but the bread provided with it was nice and flaky. The kabobs themselves from what i saw in the pictures from previous reviews looked grilled but mine appeared to have been grilled and than cooked in a pan since they didnt have a crusty exterior on them as you would normally expect. Aesthetics wise it didnt look good but did taste fine to me. I am giving it two stars, the service was decent just the food wasnt what i would expect. If in  town again i would give it a go during lunch time to see if the food is different but thats for another day.

Ok so I decided to check out Fresh Kabob for lunch one day as it is close to my place of employment. 

The staff is friendly and helpful as I did ask some questions as this was my first visit. I decided on the #4 (1) Tenderloin beef shish kabob. The meal includes fresh bread, tomato, onion, mixed greens and saffron rice. $8.99

The meat was dry, tough and chewy the taste it left in my mouth was that of burnt charcoal.  Wow so disappointed I was as the meat should have been the star of the meal. The saffron rice and the fresh taftoon persian bread was good however not enough to warrant a repeat visit.

My meal by itself cost $9 and change for a couple small bits of meat, rice, homemade taftoon persian bread, veggies and a bitter tomato.

Yeah, I don't think I will be making a return visit here anytime soon. I really wanted to like and enjoy this place since is so close to work :(.

I was left unsatisfied, empty, wanting more, needing more, and in need of something to remove the bad taste from my mouth.

The trend continues.
I know that my last review for this place is also a 3* however this one is a not so shiny 3*. 

Here are they key reasons why:
Price increase with a inverse correlation to portion. (fancy UNLV talk for more money and less food)
The mix and match is now $11.99
The bread is now $1.99
Mat-o-khir is now $1.99 (albeit you get 1/2 a round of bread with it)

Frequent eater punch card:
They changed it from meals to visits. In addition I told them that I forgot the card once or twice and they gave me a new one. The cards totaled more than enough for a free meal however, they did not honor it. 

This place has been my default Kebob place in Vegas for nearly 5 years but I am slowly falling out of love with it as I no longer feel that it is a great value that it once was. I may have to search the valley for another spot to get my Kabob fix at. 

Still a fan of the food but don't like the direction that this place is going...

If you love good food, you'll love Fresh Kabob. I'm here at least twice a week to eat on my lunch hour. The food is amazing; tons of veggie/vegan options with hearty portions at a more-than-decent price tag. The staff and service is always friendly, not to mention pretty speedy. 

I've talked to the owner on several occasions, and you can tell how much love and pride he has for his business and the experience his customers have.

I come here often for lunch. The food is very good but the girls who work the cash register seem rude and like they're always in bad moods when I go which makes me feel awkward. Their hummus is great and if you order a kabob plate it's a lot of food which is nice.

It has been a long time since I have heard someone speak so passionately about the fundamentals of their food as Hamid Ashraf.  Because this restaurant never, ever freezes anything, practices cruelty free trade and makes their own bread daily, I couldn't help but fall in love with it.  Average ticket price is $11.50 which is great for fresh food.  Wish they would open a second location closer to me, but all in all, this is a great choice for Mediterrean in Las Vegas.
